path_1.title: Chalk It Up (2016)
path_1.feeling: Cute empowerment vibes but super cheesy and low-rent

path_1.title: Pacific Rim (2013)
path_1.feeling: Big and bombastic, but the teamwork and heart kept me engaged.

path_1.title: Well Wishes (2015)
path_1.feeling: Whimsical idea with an amiable tone, but it never quite clicks beyond a light chuckle.

path_1.title: Beauty and the Beast (1991)
path_1.feeling: Pure Disney magic—swept away by the music, romance, and heart.

path_1.title: Princess Diaries, The (2001)
path_1.feeling: Adorable glow-up fantasy with sweetness and humor that totally charms me.

path_1.title: Clueless (1995)
path_1.feeling: Effortlessly witty and warm

path_1.title: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri (2017)
path_1.feeling: Fierce, messy, and powerful—hard to love, easy to admire.

path_1.title: American Teen (2008)
path_1.feeling: Familiar high-school archetypes, but engaging enough to keep me invested.

path_1.title: In Your Eyes (2014)
path_1.feeling: The telepathic romance is swoony and odd in a way I found endearing despite the rough edges.

path_1.title: Repo! The Genetic Opera (2008)
path_1.feeling: Wild and stylish, but the grim gore keeps me at arm’s length even as the songs stick.

path_1.title: Sound of Music, The (1965)
path_1.feeling: Joyful, sweeping, and endlessly rewatchable—my heart sings.

path_1.title: Paris, I Love You (Paris, je t'aime) (2006)
path_1.feeling: Uneven by nature, yet the romantic mosaic of Paris left me glowing.

path_1.title: Arrival (2016)
path_1.feeling: Intimate, humane sci‑fi that moved me deeply.

path_1.title: Spotlight (2015)
path_1.feeling: Gripping, respectful journalism drama that left me thoughtful and heavy.

path_1.title: Chef (2014)
path_1.feeling: Deliciously feel‑good—family, food, and second chances hit the spot.

path_1.title: The Fault in Our Stars (2014)
path_1.feeling: Earnest and tear‑tugging, it got me even when I saw the beats coming.

path_1.title: Love & Friendship (2016)
path_1.feeling: Austen wit delivered with fizzy bite

path_1.title: Music of the Heart (1999)
path_1.feeling: Inspiring teacher‑and‑kids story that hits my soft spot.

path_1.title: Devil Wears Prada, The (2006)
path_1.feeling: Smart, sparkly, and empowering—an instant comfort watch.

path_1.title: My Best Friend's Wedding (1997)
path_1.feeling: Messy love and great laughs with a bittersweet sting I enjoyed.

path_1.title: Moulin Rouge (2001)
path_1.feeling: A dizzy, romantic spectacular that swept me off my feet.

path_1.title: Beautiful Mind, A (2001)
path_1.feeling: Polished and affecting, with an uplifting arc that worked for me.

path_1.title: Crazy, Stupid, Love. (2011)
path_1.feeling: Funny, heartfelt ensemble rom‑com with real warmth.

path_1.title: Love, Simon (2018)
path_1.feeling: Sweet, sincere, and affirming—exactly my kind of teen romance.

path_1.title: My Fair Lady (1964)
path_1.feeling: Glorious songs and sparkling banter—I was utterly charmed.

path_1.title: The Edge of Seventeen (2016)
path_1.feeling: Sharp, funny, and tender in all the right coming‑of‑age ways.

path_1.title: Elf (2003)
path_1.feeling: Jolly, quotable, and cozy—holiday joy in a bottle.

path_1.title: Princess Cyd (2017)
path_1.feeling: Gentle and thoughtful, a small slice of life that warmed me more than wowed me.

path_1.title: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri (2017)
path_1.feeling: A gut‑punch of a drama—uneasy yet compelling and superbly acted.

path_1.title: Sleeping Beauty (1959)
path_1.feeling: Lush and enchanting, if a touch more formal than my top‑tier Disney favorites.

path_2.title: Chalk It Up (2016)
path_2.feeling: Cute, girl-power underdog arc I enjoyed even if it felt a bit lightweight.

path_2.title: Pacific Rim (2013)
path_2.feeling: Big, earnest spectacle with teamwork vibes that scratched my sci-fi itch.

path_2.title: Well Wishes (2015)
path_2.feeling: A whimsical premise with gentle heart, pleasant if a little slight.

path_2.title: Beauty and the Beast (1991)
path_2.feeling: Swept away by the romance, songs, and that enchanted ballroom glow.

path_2.title: Princess Diaries, The (2001)
path_2.feeling: Adorkable wish-fulfillment with heart and humor that left me grinning.

path_2.title: Clueless (1995)
path_2.feeling: Fizzy, witty fun with surprising warmth that never gets old.

path_2.title: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri (2017)
path_2.feeling: Powerful and prickly, I admired the performances even as it left me bruised.

path_2.title: American Teen (2008)
path_2.feeling: Engaging snapshot of high school cliques that felt honest if familiar.

path_2.title: In Your Eyes (2014)
path_2.feeling: A tender, dreamy sci-fi romance that made my heart flutter.

path_2.title: Repo! The Genetic Opera (2008)
path_2.feeling: Gothic, weird, and catchy—messy but intriguingly operatic.

path_2.feeling: Intimate, brainy awe that moved me deeply.

path_2.title: Spotlight (2015)

path_2.title: Chef (2014)

path_2.feeling: Sincere and swoony tearjerker that left me misty but uplifted.

path_2.feeling: Snappy, stylish, and irresistible—comfort-watch catnip for me.

path_2.title: Love, Simon (2018)
